summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs news briefing summary from July 8, 2019, reporting on the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro Airport. It details the new federal sex trafficking charges against him, references his controversial 2007 plea deal, and discusses the political implications involving figures like Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta, President Trump, and others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Billionaire financier arrested at Teterboro Airport and accused of sex trafficking minors in Florida and New York. He had previously struck a plea deal in 2007.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Was the US Attorney who authorized Epstein's 2007 plea deal. Defended the deal during his confirmation hearing and is facing calls for accountability following Epstein's 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: A lawyer for Jeffrey Epstein who, via email, indicated Epstein planned to plead not guilty to the new charges.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Described as having been friends with Epstein, living near him in Palm Beach, flying on his private jet, and attending social events with him.

persons.name: Christine Pelosi
persons.context: Daughter of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Tweeted that the Epstein case is horrific and that figures 'on the left and the right' may be implicated.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Mentioned as the mother of Christine Pelosi, who commented on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Steve Hilton
persons.context: Host on Fox News who commented that it was time for Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta to be held accountable.

persons.name: Kathy Park
persons.context: Reported on NBC Nightly News that Acosta had defended his decision on the Epstein plea deal and that the Labor Department referred inquiries to the DOJ.

connections.description: Acosta, as US Attorney, authorized the 2007 non-prosecution agreement/plea deal for Epstein, which is now under scrutiny.
Described as having been friends, with Trump flying on Epstein's jet and attending social events with him.
Goldberger is identified as a lawyer for Epstein, stating his client's intent to plead not guilty.
Christine Pelosi is identified as the daughter of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

events.title: Epstein Arrested at Teterboro
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI-NYPD Crimes Against Children Task Force at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey after returning on a flight from France.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein struck a plea deal for charges related to recruiting underage girls, serving 13 months in county jail, registering as a sex offender, and receiving immunity from federal charges for himself and potential co-conspirators.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed in Manhattan
events.description: A new indictment was to be unsealed in Manhattan federal court, charging Epstein with one count of sex trafficking of minors and one count of conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking of minors.

locations: New York City's Metropolitan Correctional Center
Epstein's Upper East Side mansion, New York
Epstein's palatial residence in Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport upon returning from France, based on a new federal indictment for sex trafficking minors.
The 2007 plea deal, authorized by then-US Attorney Alexander Acosta, gave Epstein and other potential co-conspirators immunity from federal charges in Florida.
The new indictment from the Southern District of New York could result in a maximum sentence of 45 years for Epstein.
Political figures, including President Trump and Labor Secretary Acosta, are linked to Epstein in the reporting, raising questions about their prior knowledge.
Christine Pelosi suggested that the Epstein case could implicate popular figures 'on the left and the right.'
